subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Fernando Alonso was dropped from the pole position at the Hungarian Grand Prix in Budapest for delaying his McLaren teammate Lewis Hamilton during qualifying. Hamilton had questioned Alonso’s tactics during a lengthy pit stop, and officials from FIA, world racing’s governing body, changed the qualifying standings — which initially had Alonso on the pole and Hamilton second. Officials also said that McLaren, which led the team standings by 27 points over Ferrari, would not earn any points from the race. Officials from FIA said that Alonso, the two-time defending champion from Spain, and his McLaren crew delayed Hamilton, a rookie driver from England, for 20 seconds after the completion of a tire change. In a statement, FIA said the delay was “considered prejudicial to the interests of the competition and to the interests of motor sport generally.”.
